wand.description: A wand is a magic staff used by wizards and witches to cast spells.

school supplies.description: Harry buys school supplies, including a wand and supplies for his Quidditch team, from Ollivander's Wand Shop.

invisibility cloak.description: The invisibility cloak is a magic cloak that makes the wearer invisible.

mirror erised.location: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
mirror erised.description: The Mirror of Erised shows what the viewer most desires.

sorting hat.location: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
sorting hat.description: The sorting hat is a magical object that sorts the students among four houses – Gryffindor, Slytherin, Hufflepuff, and Ravenclaw.

broomstick.description: Harry's broomstick is a Nimbus 2000, which is the best broom for Quidditch.

letter school.description: The letter school is a school where students go to learn about magic.

school uniform.description: All students wear red or purple robes and a pointed hat.

quidditch team.description: The Gryffindor Quidditch team is led by Harry Potter and is known for its prowess in the air.

school owl.description: Harry's owl is named Hedwig, and she is a good owl who helps Harry with schoolwork.

persons family.description: Harry's abusive aunt and uncle, Vernon and Petunia Dursley and their bullying son, Dudley live with them.

money.description: Money is a valuable resource used to purchase goods and services.

good fortune.description: Harry Potter was able to achieve several successes during his time at Hogwarts, such as being on the Quidditch team and being able to save the school from an attempted robbery.

power.description: The power of the mirror is that it shows what the viewer most desires.

beauty.description: Beauty is something that is seen on the inside.

love.description: Love is a powerful emotion that can make people do great things.

white car.description: The car in the story is a white Ford Anglia.

brown dog.description: The brown dog is a friendly animal that Harry befriends on his journey to Hogwarts.

single flower.description: The flower in the garden of the Dursleys' home is a dandelion.

mailbox.description: The mailbox is near the front of the house and has a "Privet Drive" sign on it.

wand core.location: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
wand core.description: The wand core is the part of the wand that is made of wood, and it contains the magic that makes the wand work.

bracelet.location: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
bracelet.description: The bracelet is a gold bracelet with a snake on the front.

philosophers stone.description: The philosophers stone is a diamond-like object that is said to grant its holder immortality and the ability to turn any metal into pure gold.

cupboard.description: The cupboard in which Harry spends most of his time at the Dursleys is a small, dark, and damp space where the family stores their food.

television.description: Television is a medium used to watch moving images that are usually accompanied by sound.

living room.description: The living room in the Dursleys' home was always filled with unpleasant smells.

kitchen.description: The kitchen is a large, dark room where the Dursleys cook their meals. There is a stove, a refrigerator, and a cupboard.

garden.description: The garden has a small pond and a few small trees.

harrys.description: Harry is 11 when he is accepted to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, which he had been trying to attend for years because he knew his parents were wizards.
